004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/** A rotation in a 2d coordinate frame represented a point on the unit circle (cosine and sine). */
017@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
018@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
019public class Rotation2d implements Interpolatable<Rotation2d> {
020  private final double m_value;
021  private final double m_cos;
022  private final double m_sin;
023
024  /** Constructs a Rotation2d with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
025  public Rotation2d() {
026    m_value = 0.0;
027    m_cos = 1.0;
028    m_sin = 0.0;
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given radian value. The x and y don't have to be normalized.
033   *
034   * @param value The value of the angle in radians.
035   */
036  @JsonCreator
037  public Rotation2d(@JsonProperty(required = true, value = "radians") double value) {
038    m_value = value;
039    m_cos = Math.cos(value);
040    m_sin = Math.sin(value);
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given x and y (cosine and sine) components.
045   *
046   * @param x The x component or cosine of the rotation.
047   * @param y The y component or sine of the rotation.
048   */
049  public Rotation2d(double x, double y) {
050    double magnitude = Math.hypot(x, y);
051    if (magnitude > 1e-6) {
052      m_sin = y / magnitude;
053      m_cos = x / magnitude;
054    } else {
055      m_sin = 0.0;
056      m_cos = 1.0;
057    }
058    m_value = Math.atan2(m_sin, m_cos);
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given radian value.
063   *
064   * @param radians The value of the angle in degrees.
065   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
066   */
067  public static Rotation2d fromRadians(double radians) {
068    return new Rotation2d(radians);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given degree value.
073   *
074   * @param degrees The value of the angle in degrees.
075   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
076   */
077  public static Rotation2d fromDegrees(double degrees) {
078    return new Rotation2d(Math.toRadians(degrees));
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given number of rotations.
083   *
084   * @param rotations The value of the angle in rotations.
085   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
086   */
087  public static Rotation2d fromRotations(double rotations) {
088    return new Rotation2d(Units.rotationsToRadians(rotations));
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Adds two rotations together, with the result being bounded between -pi and pi.
093   *
094   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(30).plus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(60))</code> equals
095   * <code>Rotation2d(Math.PI/2.0)</code>
096   *
097   * @param other The rotation to add.
098   * @return The sum of the two rotations.
099   */
100  public Rotation2d plus(Rotation2d other) {
101    return rotateBy(other);
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Subtracts the new rotation from the current rotation and returns the new rotation.
106   *
107   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(10).minus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(100))</code>
108   * equals <code>Rotation2d(-Math.PI/2.0)</code>
109   *
110   * @param other The rotation to subtract.
111   * @return The difference between the two rotations.
112   */
113  public Rotation2d minus(Rotation2d other) {
114    return rotateBy(other.unaryMinus());
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Takes the inverse of the current rotation. This is simply the negative of the current angular
119   * value.
120   *
121   * @return The inverse of the current rotation.
122   */
123  public Rotation2d unaryMinus() {
124    return new Rotation2d(-m_value);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Multiplies the current rotation by a scalar.
129   *
130   * @param scalar The scalar.
131   * @return The new scaled Rotation2d.
132   */
133  public Rotation2d times(double scalar) {
134    return new Rotation2d(m_value * scalar);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Adds the new rotation to the current rotation using a rotation matrix.
139   *
140   * <p>The matrix multiplication is as follows:
141   *
142   * <pre>
143   * [cos_new]   [other.cos, -other.sin][cos]
144   * [sin_new] = [other.sin,  other.cos][sin]
145   * value_new = atan2(sin_new, cos_new)
146   * </pre>
147   *
148   * @param other The rotation to rotate by.
149   * @return The new rotated Rotation2d.
150   */
151  public Rotation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
152    return new Rotation2d(
153        m_cos * other.m_cos - m_sin * other.m_sin, m_cos * other.m_sin + m_sin * other.m_cos);
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Returns the radian value of the Rotation2d.
158   *
159   * @return The radian value of the Rotation2d.
160   */
161  @JsonProperty
162  public double getRadians() {
163    return m_value;
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Returns the degree value of the Rotation2d.
168   *
169   * @return The degree value of the Rotation2d.
170   */
171  public double getDegrees() {
172    return Math.toDegrees(m_value);
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Returns the number of rotations of the Rotation2d.
177   *
178   * @return The number of rotations of the Rotation2d.
179   */
180  public double getRotations() {
181    return Units.radiansToRotations(m_value);
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Returns the cosine of the Rotation2d.
186   *
187   * @return The cosine of the Rotation2d.
188   */
189  public double getCos() {
190    return m_cos;
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Returns the sine of the Rotation2d.
195   *
196   * @return The sine of the Rotation2d.
197   */
198  public double getSin() {
199    return m_sin;
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Returns the tangent of the Rotation2d.
204   *
205   * @return The tangent of the Rotation2d.
206   */
207  public double getTan() {
208    return m_sin / m_cos;
209  }
210
211  @Override
212  public String toString() {
213    return String.format("Rotation2d(Rads: %.2f, Deg: %.2f)", m_value, Math.toDegrees(m_value));
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Checks equality between this Rotation2d and another object.
218   *
219   * @param obj The other object.
220   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
221   */
222  @Override
223  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
224    if (obj instanceof Rotation2d) {
225      var other = (Rotation2d) obj;
226      return Math.hypot(m_cos - other.m_cos, m_sin - other.m_sin) < 1E-9;
227    }
228    return false;
229  }
230
231  @Override
232  public int hashCode() {
233    return Objects.hash(m_value);
234  }
235
236  @Override
237  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
238  public Rotation2d interpolate(Rotation2d endValue, double t) {
239    return plus(endValue.minus(this).times(MathUtil.clamp(t, 0, 1)));
240  }
241}
